intro: Asprella australis, commonly known as the Australian asprella, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. Asprella australis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
